name: AddOrgAccessToRunnerGroup
description:
Add organization access to a self-hosted runner group in an enterprise.

Use this tool to add an organization to a selected list that can access a self-hosted runner group. The runner group's visibility must be set to 'selected'. Requires an access token with 'manage_runners:enterprise' scope.

parameters.name: enterprise_identifier
parameters.description: The slug or ID of the enterprise. Use either the enterprise name slug or its ID.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: runner_group_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the self-hosted runner group. Required for adding organization access to it.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization to add access to the self-hosted runner group.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: enterprise
parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: runner_group_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the self-hosted runner group.

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
